description.part1: enables communication with locally running MCP servers that provide additional tools and resources to extend CoolCline's capabilities. You can use
description.part2: or ask CoolCline to create new tools specific to your workflow (e.g., "add a tool that gets the latest npm docs").

enable.title: Enable MCP Servers
enable.description: When enabled, CoolCline will be able to interact with MCP servers for advanced functionality. If you're not using MCP, you can disable this to reduce CoolCline's token usage.

serverCreation.title: Enable MCP Server Creation
serverCreation.description: When enabled, CoolCline can help you create new MCP servers via commands like "add a new tool to...". If you don't need to create MCP servers you can disable this to reduce CoolCline's token usage.

timeout.title: Network Timeout
timeout.description: Maximum time to wait for server responses

language.title: Language
language.description: Set the AI assistant's response language, the interface will also switch to the selected language

customInstructions.title: General Behavior Instructions
customInstructions.description: These instructions apply to all modes as base behavior guidelines, which can be extended by mode-specific instructions below
customInstructions.loadFrom: Instructions can also be loaded from

modePrompts.title: Prompt Settings
modePrompts.description: Hit the + to create a new custom mode, or just ask CoolCline in chat to create one for you!
modePrompts.name: Name

slug.title: Identifier
slug.description: A unique identifier used in URLs and file names, should only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens

roleDefinition.title: Role Definition
roleDefinition.description: Define CoolCline's expertise and personality traits for this mode, which will determine its working style and behavior
roleDefinition.createDescription: Define the expertise and personality traits for this mode

apiConfig.title: API Configuration
apiConfig.description: Select API configuration for this mode
apiConfig.enhancePrompts: You can select an API configuration specifically for prompt enhancement

tools.title: Available Tools
tools.cannotModify: Tools for built-in modes cannot be modified
tools.selectTools: Select which tools this mode can use
tools.selectDescription: Select which tools this mode can use

customInstructions.title: Mode-specific Instructions
customInstructions.description: Add behavioral guidelines specific to {mode} mode
customInstructions.loadFrom: Mode-specific instructions for {mode} can also be loaded from
customInstructions.createDescription: Add behavioral guidelines specific to this mode

api.title: API Settings
api.description: Save multiple API configurations for quick switching between different providers and settings

enhance.label: Prompt Enhancement
enhance.description: Get more precise suggestions and improvements through prompt enhancement. This ensures CoolCline accurately understands your intent and provides the best response. Available via the âœ¨ icon in chat interface.

explain.label: Code Explanation
explain.description: Get detailed explanations of code snippets, functions, or entire files. Suitable for understanding complex code or learning new programming patterns. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

fix.label: Issue Fix
fix.description: Help identify and resolve program errors, bugs, or code quality issues, providing step-by-step fix guidance. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

improve.label: Code Optimization
improve.description: Get code optimization suggestions, best practices, and architectural improvements while maintaining functionality. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

addToContext.label: Add Context
addToContext.description: Add supplementary information to current task or conversation. Used for providing additional explanations or clarifying details. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

welcome.title: What can I do for you?
welcome.description: CoolCline is a proactive programming assistant that enhances your development workflow with advanced AI capabilities. It helps you write code more efficiently, optimize queries, auto-fix errors, run command-line tasks, and perform browser automation tests.

messages.executeCommand: CoolCline wants to execute this command:
messages.question: CoolCline has a question:
messages.searchDirectory: CoolCline wants to search this directory for

customization.title: Custom Modes: Celebrating Our New Identity
customization.description: To mark this new chapter, we're introducing the power to shape CoolCline into any role you need! Create specialized personas and create an entire team of agents with deeply customized prompts:

examples.qa: QA Engineers who write thorough test cases and catch edge cases
examples.pm: Product Managers who excel at user stories and feature prioritization
examples.ui: UI/UX Designers who craft beautiful, accessible interfaces
examples.reviewer: Code Reviewers who ensure quality and maintainability

customization.getStarted: Just click the notebook icon to get started with Custom Modes!

join.title: Join Us for the Next Chapter
join.description: We can't wait to see how you'll push CoolCline's potential even further! Share your custom modes and join the discussion at

autoApprove.title: Auto-approve
autoApprove.description: Auto-approve allows CoolCline to perform actions without asking for permission. Only enable for actions you fully trust.

readFiles.label: Read files and directories
readFiles.description: Allows access to read any file on your computer.

editFiles.label: Edit files
editFiles.description: Allows modification of any files on your computer.

executeCommands.label: Execute approved commands
executeCommands.description: Allows execution of approved terminal commands. You can configure this in the settings panel.

useBrowser.label: Use the browser
useBrowser.description: Allows ability to launch and interact with any website in a headless browser.

useMcp.label: Use MCP servers
useMcp.description: Allows use of configured MCP servers which may modify filesystem or interact with APIs.

switchModes.label: Switch modes & create tasks
switchModes.description: Allows automatic switching between different AI modes and creating new tasks without requiring approval.

retryRequests.label: Retry failed requests
retryRequests.description: Automatically retry failed API requests when the provider returns an error response.

input.dragImages: , hold shift to drag in images
